abstract: The history of war in Australia, as seen through the Australian War Memorial in Canberra.
description: An informational piece about the origin and purpose of The Australian War Memorial, showing the grounds, exterior and some of its exhibits, particularly artwork, dioramas and sculpture. This film includes rare colour footage (taken during  Elizabeth's 1954 Royal Visit) of the Queen and the Duke of Edinburgh )visiting the Memorial. They are escorted by the Memorial's founder and Australia's official World War I historian, Charles Edward Woodrow Bean. The War Memorial's famous Lancaster warplane "G for George" is shown, and a midget Japanese submarine, at that time stored outside the Memorial. Scenes of a Remembrance Day ceremony are also included, with Prime Minister Menzies laying a wreath.
